title: The best and worst games of the year
summary: This year has been a very good year for video games. With all the excellent titles that have already released, thereâ€™s plenty for gamers to look forward to in 2019. There has been something for everyone this year, including a brand new property or a return to an older title. The worst game of the year was Crackdown 3, with a few bugs and a lack of content compared to other online games released this year. The best video game of 2019 is Assassin's Creed: Odyssey, the latest chapter of the Tomb Raider.

In 2018, we saw new entries in long-running series like Red Dead Redemption, Assassin\u2019s Creed, and Halo as well as brand new IP such as Monster Hunter: World, Into the Breach, and A Way Out. It was a year that saw game developers pushed by streaming services like Twitch and YouTube continue to experiment with new ideas and designs while also returning to their roots with older properties.
That being said, not all games are created equal. There are excellent games and then there are... others less so. To help you sort through the deluge of new releases this year, Gamers Central has compiled a list of our top ten favorite titles coupled with an even longer list of disappointments that you may want to avoid entirely or at least wait for a sale before picking up.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Odyssey takes that formula and not only improves it but also transports it to an entirely new era."),mdx("p",null,"Red Dead Redemption 2 - Rockstar Games is no stranger to long gaps between releases, and it\u2019s been nearly eight years since the release of their last Western-style game, Red Dead Redemption. Thankfully, the sequel is well worth the wait, offering a vast open world, a massive amount of content, and a story that is just as compelling as it was back in 2010."),mdx("p",null,"Halo Infinite - When a new console generation starts, it\u2019s not uncommon for some of the biggest, most iconic franchises to sit out the initial release. Halo is one of these, and while it is a shame that we won\u2019t see a new mainline entry this year, the next big thing in the series is looking exciting indeed."),mdx("p",null,"Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The latest chapter in Lara Croft\u2019s story is one that ends the trilogy on a high note. Taking inspiration from classic adventure games, the Tomb Raider series is at its best when it is focused on exploration, puzzle solving, and combat."),mdx("h2",null,"The Worst"),mdx("p",null,"Cyberpunk 2077 - This may seem like an odd choice given that Cyberpunk 2077 is still years off from release, but it\u2019s hard to ignore the fact that the game\u2019s original announcement was over a decade ago. Yes, CD Projekt Red has had their hands full creating a new game engine, but with the buzz and hype around this title, the developer has created a situation where the expectations are so high that anything short of amazing will be seen as a disappointment."),mdx("p",null,"Anthem - The idea behind BioWare making a multiplayer action-RPG has a lot of potential behind it. The execution, however, has proven to be a bit of a mess. With a smattering of bugs, a lack of content compared to other online games released this year, and online implementation that is a bit clunky, this title has a lot to be desired."),mdx("p",null,"Crackdown 3 - It\u2019s tough to be a launch title, especially when you\u2019re one of the very few games tied to the release of a brand new console. It\u2019s even harder when your release date is pushed back because your development team was too ambitious, and that\u2019s exactly what happened with Crackdown 3."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"With all that being said, it has been a very good year for video games. Developers have pushed themselves to create something new and exciting while also giving players a chance to enjoy some of their favorite franchises from years past. Whether it be a brand new property or a return to an older title, there has been something for everyone this year. And with all the excellent titles that have already released, there\u2019s plenty for gamers to look forward to in 2019."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

These are also some of the most challenging and difficult ones to make. Cracking the code on how to build a well-crafted and engaging video game requires practice, ingenuity, skill, and patience. But not every developer is up to the task. Some simply fail at creating an entertaining experience for players. This list compiles some of the disappointments from 2018 that failed to meet an acceptable standard of quality.
These are the worst games of 2018, broken down by category and listed in no particular order. Some might have had good intentions or interesting concepts, but fell short in their execution. If you\u2019re looking for something new to play this year, stay away from these titles as they won\u2019t give you your money\u2019s worth or much satisfaction beyond finishing them once (if that).`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

From binge-watching Christmas TV specials to baking gingerbread cookies and sipping hot cocoa, there are plenty of ways to get into the holiday spirit. And what better way to keep that good cheer going than by playing a game with your significant other?
With so many different board games available on the market, it can be challenging to figure out which ones are worth investing in. Thankfully, this list features some of the best games perfect for couples this holiday season. Whether you\u2019re looking for a light-hearted romp or an intense challenge that brings you closer as partners, these games have you covered.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Kids

In fact, the market for kids games has grown so much that there is now a range of specialist games developers who only make games targeted at this audience. The release of new gaming devices such as the Nintendo Switch, Google Stadia and the Xbox Scarlett has also led to a renewed interest in kid-friendly games from parents and other adult gamers. Here we have put together our favorite kid-friendly video games that you can play at home with your child or let them play on their own to help develop their skills."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The 5 Most Overrated Games of the Year

intro.compiledSource:
var m=Object.defineProperty,d=Object.defineProperties;var p=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var s=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,n=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var l=(e,t,a)=>t in e?m(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:a}):e[t]=a,i=(e,t)=>{for(var a in t||(t={}))r.call(t,a)&&l(e,a,t[a]);if(s)for(var a of s(t))n.call(t,a)&&l(e,a,t[a]);return e},h=(e,t)=>d(e,p(t));var u=(e,t)=>{var a={};for(var o in e)r.call(e,o)&&t.indexOf(o)<0&&(a[o]=e[o]);if(e!=null&&s)for(var o of s(e))t.indexOf(o)<0&&n.call(e,o)&&(a[o]=e[o]);return a};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(a){var o=a,{components:e}=o,t=u(o,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(i(i({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`It is the time of year when game journalists and bloggers around the world start posting lists of their favourite video games from the past 12 months. These are often referred to as \u201CGame of the Year\u201D awards, but they are not all created equal. Some use a points-based system, while others ask critics to vote on individual games and not just give them a list of possible answers.
There is also no standard definition for what qualifies as an \u201Coverrated\u201D game. Some people might interpret it to mean any game that received generally positive reviews but has little chance of winning a Game of the Year award. Others assume it must be a high-profile title that almost everyone agrees is terrible but continues to sell well because it has been overhyped by gaming journalists and analysts. In this article we will look at five overrated video games from 2018 that were widely praised, but do not measure up to their reputation.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

var y=Object.defineProperty,l=Object.defineProperties;var u=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,h=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var i=(e,t,a)=>t in e?y(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:a}):e[t]=a,r=(e,t)=>{for(var a in t||(t={}))s.call(t,a)&&i(e,a,t[a]);if(n)for(var a of n(t))h.call(t,a)&&i(e,a,t[a]);return e},m=(e,t)=>l(e,u(t));var p=(e,t)=>{var a={};for(var o in e)s.call(e,o)&&t.indexOf(o)<0&&(a[o]=e[o]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var o of n(e))t.indexOf(o)<0&&h.call(e,o)&&(a[o]=e[o]);return a};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(a){var o=a,{components:e}=o,t=p(o,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,m(r(r({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re interested in video games, you have probably heard that 2018 was a great year for gaming. It was. But it wasn\u2019t just this past year\u2014gaming has been on the upswing for a while now. There are more gamers playing more games than ever before, and it\u2019s an exciting time to be part of this culture.
There are so many excellent video games released every month that it can be overwhelming to keep track of them all. That\u2019s why we\u2019ve compiled a list of what we think are the best new games from the last few months of 2018 that everyone should play if they get the opportunity:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Experts
The Top 5 Games of the Year

We spend lots of time playing them, talking about them with friends and family, thinking about them and even dreaming about them. The games we play also reflect who we are as individuals. They serve as a mirror that reflects back an image of our unique personalities. Each one of us has different preferences and taste in games. There\u2019s also a lot to choose from, too: There are so many video games today that no individual can ever hope to try them all. That said, there are some great ones out there and they come in all shapes and sizes: Action-adventure, shooters, RPGs; you name it! Here is a list of the top 5 games this year that you must play if you haven\u2019t already:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for People Who like to Win
